result.name: THE LOBBY LOUNGE

reviews.text:
It’s one of my favourite hotel in town. 
The lobby lounge was a nice place for afternoon tea. I went there so often. The food and service was excellent! 
But the weekend buffet tea is a nightmare. Staffs are ignorant and lazy!!
Best place to relax with friends! Do try their fluffy pancakes while they are still here?
Good service, good food and good atmosphere
Today I have wonderful time with Amy at the lobby Iounge of Shangrila HK. We have tea buffet there， the food and deserts are nice. We feel good relax together.
Truly TERRIBLE tea - warm water and cold tea. Congealed meat, cold dim sum and fake cream. When we complained about the cold tea, we were told we could have had coffee! Also, £45 a head.

result.adr_address: Salisbury Rd, Tsim Sha Tsui, Hong Kong
result.formatted_address: Salisbury Rd, Tsim Sha Tsui, Hong Kong
result.name: The Peninsula The Lobby

reviews.text: Charming hotel with a very classy lobby. Had the High Tea here. Food was good and the atmosphere was great. The classical quartet was very competent as well, they played classical (Bach) to contemporary and jazz. Very enjoyable indeed.

I tried the Peninsula Classic Afternoon Tea and dinner there for several times and the experience is good until last time we visit there for dinner.  

We made a reservation for dinner at 6:30pm but come earlier at 6pm due to meeting finished earlier.  We talked to the waiter there and expressed that we come earlier, the waiter just said he will check and walked away.  After several minutes, we asked another waiter for the same thing, he just looked at his watch and ask us to wait.  It gave me an impression that he was thinking “Your reservation is 6:30pm, why you come so early?”, which made us start feeling unpleasant.  Then the waiters and other several waiters and manager just gather around the counter looking at the workstations but doing nothing at all.  At last we asked the manger the same question, and again, he just told us to wait.  Up to this moment, NOT ONE there could give me an actual answer or offer us a seat, so I finally lost may patience and told the manager and waiters that they don’t need to bother anymore, I will eat somewhere else.

I was not aware that the dinner serving time there was starting from 6:30pm, but the staff there could told me that and offer me to sit down first, instead of just leaving us standing there like a fool and didn’t know what was happening. 

I am very disappointed of receiving such bad service at such a legendary Five-Star hotel.

We tried the afternoon tea crossover with Harry Winston.   I was totally disappointed with the food.   The sandwiches bread doesn't taste good at all probably it's because they were store in fridge before and obviously the breads are all wet and soggy.  The mini bagel is disappointing as well.   The scone is okay.  There is nothing special with the desserts and the macaroon is not soft enough.  The only good side about this afternoon tea is you get a set of Harry Winston spoons which are quite special.  I tried the peninsula blend tea which is good and service is good.

We had a light dinner in The Lobby on the Monday evening of 8th July 2019 . The food was average with poor service . It was quite quiet with only 3 or 4 tables only around 8pm in The Lobby when we arrived ! However, it took at least 4 to 5 minutes for the waiter to approach us ( a group of 5 people standing in front of the main way next to a table leading to the open restaurant after entering he hotel from the main entrance ) which was quite hard to miss . Moreover, when the dishes arrived , one time it’s served from the right hand side then from the left hand side for the next dish then..... 
Is it really a most historical classic 5 or even 6 stars hotel in Hong Kong ?

After a festive light show by the harbour, we wanted a place to sit down and rejuvenate, and Peninsula was literally across the street, and we thought we can’t go wrong with them considering their history and reputation.

Short version: Overall experience was mediocre at best.

Service: Our host was OK, he wasn’t rude or anything, but was giving off a hint of apathy. Perhaps it was the time of the day / stress from the holiday season. However, our server mixed up our Orange Pekoe and Early Grey order, a little peculiar considering this place probably sells just as much tea as Lipton.

Food was under average. The Caesar dressing tasted like a watered down mix of mayo from a jar with some lemon juice. The lettuce was clean and crisp though.

Pro-tip: if you are going with a baby or toddler, bring your own booster. Their highchair's safety belt was so pungent (probably from other kids chewing on it and leaving it in storage to incubate), we ended up holding our daughter the whole meal.

We'll come back to Peninsula again, but probably not to the Lobby for a "real" meal. Their tea is still great despite the little mix up.

result.name: 半島酒店 大堂茶座

reviews.text: 맛보다는 홍콩에서 역사가 깊은 호텔에서 엔티크한 티파니 실버웨어를 사용해본다는 느낌으로 가시면 나쁘지 않습니다. 페닌슐라급 호텔이 다 그렇긴 하지만 좋은 분위기에서 서버들의 노련한 헨들링도 감상할 수 있습니다. 남자보다는 여지분들에게 강추합니다

Charming hotel with a very classy lobby. Had the High Tea here. Food was good and the atmosphere was great. The classical quartet was very competent as well, they played classical (Bach) to contemporary and jazz. Very enjoyable indeed.

I tried the Peninsula Classic Afternoon Tea and dinner there for several times and the experience is good until last time we visit there for dinner.  

We made a reservation for dinner at 6:30pm but come earlier at 6pm due to meeting finished earlier.  We talked to the waiter there and expressed that we come earlier, the waiter just said he will check and walked away.  After several minutes, we asked another waiter for the same thing, he just looked at his watch and ask us to wait.  It gave me an impression that he was thinking “Your reservation is 6:30pm, why you come so early?”, which made us start feeling unpleasant.  Then the waiters and other several waiters and manager just gather around the counter looking at the workstations but doing nothing at all.  At last we asked the manger the same question, and again, he just told us to wait.  Up to this moment, NOT ONE there could give me an actual answer or offer us a seat, so I finally lost may patience and told the manager and waiters that they don’t need to bother anymore, I will eat somewhere else.

I was not aware that the dinner serving time there was starting from 6:30pm, but the staff there could told me that and offer me to sit down first, instead of just leaving us standing there like a fool and didn’t know what was happening. 

I am very disappointed of receiving such bad service at such a legendary Five-Star hotel.

下午茶不設訂位，但位置很多，不用等很久。大堂位置很寬闊，有live band, 下午茶亦不限時。
整個下午茶的食物質素都很高，我最喜歡他的鬆餅和玫瑰茶，玫瑰茶很香，味道剛好，泡了兩個小時，味道也沒有變淡。

We tried the afternoon tea crossover with Harry Winston.   I was totally disappointed with the food.   The sandwiches bread doesn't taste good at all probably it's because they were store in fridge before and obviously the breads are all wet and soggy.  The mini bagel is disappointing as well.   The scone is okay.  There is nothing special with the desserts and the macaroon is not soft enough.  The only good side about this afternoon tea is you get a set of Harry Winston spoons which are quite special.  I tried the peninsula blend tea which is good and service is good.

result.adr_address: Salisbury Rd, Tsim Sha Tsui, Hong Kong
result.formatted_address: Salisbury Rd, Tsim Sha Tsui, Hong Kong
result.name: The Peninsula Hong Kong

html_attributions: Blue Mango Works Marketing, Production and Events

reviews.text: Let’s say you definitely pay for the experience as well as the name. As for the hotel, it was an amazing experience. Great room, great service, great location. Tea was another story. I’m vegetarian so they had to change the menu which was... interesting. Bread with cheese. Felt like I was in middle school and forgot to bring my lunch again. The helicopter experience on the other hand was an amazing experience. One I’ll never forget! This, to me, is a must when you visit Hong Kong.
Very much embedding the spirit of 5 stars hotel. I loved my short weekend in this hotel. Wonderful view on the harbour.
Iconic establishment.  Most amazing decor and dining experiences.  The ride from the airport in a Rolls-Royce phantom was pretty special.

If you are looking for one of the best hotels in Hong Kong, you are on the right place. Clean rooms, big rooms and beds, excellent hotel staff. All 5 stars deserved indeed!!! If you want Rolls Royce ride... No problem! Just perfect vacation in Hong Kong!

The service here was impeccable...our high tea was bit of a hit and a miss. Some of the food wasnt very flavorful and felt a bit dried out as they were prepared hours beforehand. The facilities were very clean and the high tea is great for wet day timetable or just to hide from the heat.
